content: Hi all. Is that possible to remove/add end-user status for all clients? thx for your answers.
@lne I don't think we have a way to do that -- individual users control their own status. Can you talk about the use case?
It'd of course be easy to script on in a management shell calling do_update_user_status in a loop over UserProfile objects.

Tim Abbott said:

lne I don't think we have a way to do that -- individual users control their own status. Can you talk about the use case?

Hi, thx for you answer. in our case, we got a new status: working remotely. some of my colleges misunderstand they can not send message to someone working at home, which may cause confusion. so my boss wonder if we can remove this status from zulip clients.

Tim Abbott said:

It'd of course be easy to script on in a management shell calling do_update_user_status in a loop over UserProfile objects.

Do you have any howto for this? I'll take a look for that.

@lne https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/production/management-commands.html is the guide for management commands. If you need someone to write a script for you to do it, you should probably get a support contract.
We don't have a way to adjust the fixed statuses in the UI, but one can fork Zulip to adjust the options there. The first thing I'd try is explaining how statuses work to the userbase, though :smile:
OK, thanks a lot for your answers.
